headline: Program Manager, Commercial Fraud, ICE Homeland Security Investigations

defaultPosition.description:
â¢Manages ICE Homeland Security Investigations (HSI)'s nationwide programs to enforce antidumping/countervailing duty (AD/CVD), trade agreements, and other trade laws via criminal and civil investigations. Provides guidance to HSI special agents and other field personnel on U.S. trade laws and policies and potential enforcement mechanisms, including how to translate a lead into a successful trade investigation. 
â¢Manages trade enforcement training programs for HSI staff, including enrollment in CBP-taught classes and the redevelopment of an 8-day Intellectual Property and Trade Enforcement Investigations course.
â¢Regularly delivers presentations on the role, mission, and work of the National Intellectual Property Coordination Center.
defaultPosition.title: Program Manager, Trade Enforcement Unit

positions.title: Program Manager, Trade Enforcement Unit

positions.description:
â¢Leads team of international trade specialists charged with managing the customs broker examination, and the broker licensing, permitting, and other administrative processes.  Provides training and coaching to team, as needed, and includes team in decision-making for branch activities.
â¢Maintains responsibility for CBPâs Role of the Broker trade transformation initiative, which is an industry-government partnership charged with exploring regulatory and policy changes related to the evolving role of licensed customs brokers.
positions.title: Branch Chief, Broker Management

positions.description:
â¢Supervised team of international trade specialists with responsibilities that include serving as liaison to the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative (USTR) in U.S. international trade policy matters and laying down CBP's strategic priorities and policies for its trade operations.
â¢Served as CBPâs lead in Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) negotiations. Provided technical support to USTR; assists in preparations for negotiations and defending U.S. policy positions during negotiations. Advanced CBPâs position on market access, rules of origin, and trade facilitation/customs cooperation chapters for these negotiations.
positions.title: Branch Chief, Trade Policy

positions.description:
â¢Served as a detailee from CBP to the Senate Finance Committee Democratic Staff.  Responsibilities included CBP oversight, Customs Reauthorization Bill, Trade Adjustment Assistance, and European trade issues.
â¢Influenced trade legislation by participating in meetings and briefings with Congressional staff, other government agencies, and the trade community on customs and trade facilitation issues, Trans-Pacific Partnership, Transatlantic Trade and Investment Partnership, and the Miscellaneous Tariff Bill.
â¢Assisted in the preparation of floor debate materials for the Russia and Moldova Permanent Normal Trade Relations Senate vote, and in briefings and other preparations for two overseas trips for Senator Baucus and Committee staff.
positions.title: Detailee

positions.description:
â¢Managed CBP's nationwide program to administer and enforce FTAs and preferential trade legislation.
â¢Translated Congressional and presidential mandates into actionable policy.
â¢Regularly represented CBP in trade agreement-related meetings and negotiations with U.S. and foreign government officials.
â¢Prepared memos and delivered briefings to high-level CBP officials.
â¢Provided detailed guidance to CBP field office personnel and the trade community on U.S. laws and CBP regulations and policies.
â¢Developed and managed training programs for CBP staff.
â¢Completed two-week detail to CBP port of Charleston, SC.  Shadowed Assistant Port Director and learned CBP processes from the entry specialists, import specialists, targeters, National Account Managers, CBP Officers, and other staff involved in trade issues at the port.
â¢Served as Acting Branch Chief, Quota, from January 2009 through January 2010.
â¢Served as Acting Branch Chief, Domestic Communications, from August to September 2008. 
â¢Periodically served as Acting Branch Chief, International Coordination.
â¢Coordinated Inspector General (IG) and General Accountability Office (GAO) audits, Congressional reports and Questions for the Record (QFRs), and other tasks.
positions.title: International Trade Specialist

positions.description:
â¢Participated in fact-finding and probable economic effects studies used by the President, Congress, and the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative in the formulation of U.S. trade policy. 
â¢Served as Project Leader for multiple studies, managing teams of up to 20 analysts and economists.
â¢Interviewed domestic and foreign industry and government representatives on international trade and competitiveness issues.
â¢Monitored import levels and the U.S. market for such manufacturing industries as steel, nonferrous metals, and semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
â¢Developed statistical data on imports, exports, and domestic production for these industries.
â¢Wrote reports on proposed trade-related legislation and amendments to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule (HTS) of the United States.
â¢Updated and maintained the HTS for industry responsibilities.
â¢Provided industry analysis for antidumping and China safeguard investigations.
â¢Participated in industry and interagency meetings on intellectual property rights issues, including ITAC and Special 301 meetings. Co-authored paper on the impact of foreign infringement of intellectual property rights on U.S. industry.
positions.title: International Trade Analyst

positions.companyName: Office of the U.S. Trade Representative
positions.description:
â¢Served as a detailee from the USITC to USTR's Office of Industry, Market Access, and Telecommunications.
â¢Regularly met with industry and government officials in the formulation of U.S. trade policy.
â¢Prepared memos, briefing materials, and speeches on manufacturing trade issues, including steel, raw materials prices, orange juice, plastics, and the Generalized System of Preferences (GSP).
â¢Drafted letters to Congress on trade issues on behalf of the USTR and the President.
â¢Prepared talking points and background information used in the WTO Non-Agricultural Market Access (NAMA) negotiations, including a short paper on generic pharmaceuticals.
â¢Participated in NAMA Trade Policy Subcommittee meetings.
â¢Reviewed Export-Import Bank of the United States economic impact analyses and provided recommendations to the USTR on these transactions.
positions.title: Detailee

positions.description:
â¢Recruited and supervised 5 interns at an association promoting awareness of international trade issues.
â¢Coordinated educational programs on trade, including an Annual Dinner with more than 400 attendees.
â¢Directed production and edited a quarterly newsletter (using Microsoft Publisher) that was distributed to 1000 members of the trade community.
â¢Completed marketing review and competition study, which were used to better market the organization.
positions.title: Program Coordinator
